meta.title: Orum Review 2026: AI Parallel Dialer for Outbound Sales Teams
meta.description: Evidence-based Orum review. AI-powered parallel dialer with live conversation coaching. Org Score 8/10, Rep Score 7/10. Best for high-volume outbound SDR teams.

jsonLd.name: Orum
jsonLd.description: AI-powered parallel dialer that connects sales reps to live prospects faster with automated voicemail drop, local presence, and real-time coaching.

hero.h1: Orum Review 2026: AI Parallel Dialer for Outbound Teams
hero.dataSource: Evidence from G2, Reddit, vendor docs & more

scores.orgRationale: High-volume dialing infrastructure with strong manager visibility, coaching tools, and CRM integrations. Best ROI when deployed across a full SDR team.
scores.repRationale: Dramatically increases live conversations per hour. Learning curve is low for reps but requires manager buy-in and CRM hygiene to get full value.

quickSummary.verdict: Orum is the leading AI parallel dialer for high-volume outbound SDR teams. It connects reps to live prospects 3-5x faster than manual dialing by simultaneously calling multiple numbers and only connecting reps when a human answers. Best for teams running 50+ dials/day per rep.
quickSummary.bestFor: SDR teams running high-volume outbound campaigns who need to maximize live conversations per hour. Particularly strong for teams using Salesforce or HubSpot with clean contact data.
quickSummary.avoidIf: Solo reps, small teams under 5 SDRs, or teams with low-quality contact lists. The per-seat cost is hard to justify below a certain call volume, and parallel dialing amplifies bad data problems.

whatIs.heading: What Is Orum?
whatIs.body: Orum is an AI-powered parallel dialer that automates the manual work of outbound calling. Instead of dialing one number at a time and waiting through busy signals, voicemails, and disconnected numbers, Orum dials multiple contacts simultaneously and only connects the rep when a live human answers. The platform includes automated voicemail drop, local presence dialing, real-time manager coaching overlays, and native CRM sync with Salesforce and HubSpot. Founded in 2018 and based in Austin, TX, Orum has raised over $50M in funding and is used by companies including Brex, Outreach, and Salesloft customers looking to increase connect rates.
whatIs.noteHtml: Evidence synthesized from G2 reviews, Reddit community discussions, vendor documentation, and job posting signals.

items.title: AI Parallel Dialing
items.description: Simultaneously dials multiple contacts and connects reps only when a live human answers. Eliminates time wasted on voicemails, busy signals, and disconnected numbers.

items.title: Automated Voicemail Drop
items.description: Pre-recorded voicemails drop instantly when calls go to voicemail, freeing the rep to move to the next call without waiting for the beep.

items.title: Local Presence Dialing
items.description: Calls display a local area code matching the prospect's location, improving answer rates by 30-40% compared to out-of-state numbers.

items.title: Live Coaching Overlay
items.description: Managers can listen to live calls and whisper coaching to reps without the prospect hearing. Real-time call scoring and talk track suggestions.

items.title: CRM Sync & Disposition
items.description: Automatic call logging, outcome disposition, and contact updates sync to Salesforce and HubSpot in real time. Reduces post-call admin by 80%.

items.title: Virtual Salesfloor
items.description: Remote-friendly virtual calling environment where reps can see each other's activity, celebrate wins, and managers can monitor team performance live.

pricing.heading: Orum Pricing
pricing.intro: Orum uses custom enterprise pricing â€” no public tiers are listed. Based on community reports and sales conversations, pricing typically runs $500-$800/user/month with annual contracts required. A free trial is available.

tiers.name: Launch
tiers.description: Core parallel dialing, voicemail drop, local presence, basic CRM sync

tiers.name: Grow
tiers.description: Everything in Launch + live coaching, advanced analytics, manager dashboards

tiers.name: Scale
tiers.description: Everything in Grow + SSO, dedicated CSM, custom integrations, SLA

pricing.noteHtml: Pricing based on community reports and vendor conversations. Contact Orum for current rates. Annual contracts are standard.

g2Reviews.heading: What G2 Reviewers Say
g2Reviews.quoteHtml: Composite insight from public sources: G2 reviewers consistently praise Orum for dramatically increasing live conversations per hour â€” many report 3-5x improvement over manual dialing. The virtual salesfloor and coaching features are frequently cited as differentiators. Main complaints center on cost ("hard to justify for small teams"), occasional call quality issues, and the learning curve for setting up CRM dispositions correctly.

personas.title: SDR Teams (5+ reps)
personas.description: The primary use case. Teams running 50+ dials/day per rep see the strongest ROI. The virtual salesfloor and live coaching make it particularly strong for remote SDR teams.

personas.title: Sales Managers
personas.description: Real-time visibility into call activity, live coaching capability, and team performance dashboards make Orum a strong tool for frontline managers.

personas.title: RevOps / Sales Ops
personas.description: CRM sync automation and call analytics reduce manual logging and provide clean data for forecasting. Requires initial setup investment.

personas.title: Solo Reps / Small Teams
personas.description: The economics don't work below a certain volume. Per-seat cost is high and parallel dialing benefits are less pronounced for reps doing under 30 dials/day.

verdict.summary: Orum is the right choice for SDR teams running high-volume outbound who need to maximize live conversations per hour. It's not a prospecting tool â€” it assumes you already have a list. The ROI case is strong for teams of 5+ reps doing 50+ dials/day.
verdict.bestFor: SDR teams of 5+ reps running 50+ dials/day with clean contact lists in Salesforce or HubSpot
verdict.avoidIf: Solo reps, teams under 5 SDRs, or teams with poor contact data quality â€” parallel dialing amplifies bad data problems

pricingBreakdown.heading: Pricing Reality
pricingBreakdown.summary: Custom pricing, annual contracts required. Community reports suggest $500-$800/user/month. At 5 reps, that's $30,000-$48,000/year. ROI positive if each rep books 2+ additional meetings/month from increased connect rates.

items.bestFor: Core dialing for growing SDR teams
Enterprise with SSO and SLA requirements

greatAt: Maximizing live conversations per hour for high-volume dialers
Real-time manager coaching without interrupting the call
Remote salesfloor culture and team visibility
breaksAtScale: Economics don't work for small teams or low-volume use cases
Parallel dialing amplifies bad contact data â€” list hygiene is critical
No built-in prospecting â€” requires a separate data source
Custom pricing makes budgeting difficult without a sales call
decisionModule.whoShouldNotBuy: Solo reps, teams under 5 SDRs, teams doing fewer than 30 dials/day per rep, or teams with poor CRM hygiene. Also not suitable as a first sales tool â€” requires an existing outbound process to layer onto.
decisionModule.implementationReality: 1-2 weeks for full deployment including CRM integration, voicemail recording, and disposition setup. Reps are typically productive within 2-3 days. Manager dashboards require additional configuration.

enterpriseReadiness.note: Solid enterprise foundation with SSO on higher tiers. SOC 2 Type II certified. Annual contracts standard.

stackPairings.reason: Clay builds the enriched contact list; Orum dials it. The combination covers the full outbound workflow.
Apollo provides the contact data and email sequences; Orum handles the calling layer.
Native integration. Orum logs calls, dispositions, and outcomes directly to Salesforce records.
Orum handles live coaching; Gong handles post-call analysis and deal intelligence. Complementary.

stackPairings.avoidWith: Direct competitor â€” choose one or the other based on which CRM you use and team size.

alternatives.name: Nooks
alternatives.reason: Closest competitor. Similar parallel dialing with strong AI coaching. Compare on pricing and CRM fit.

alternatives.name: Kixie
alternatives.reason: More affordable with transparent pricing. Better for smaller teams or those wanting month-to-month.

alternatives.name: Apollo
alternatives.reason: Apollo includes a basic dialer. Not as powerful for high-volume calling but eliminates a separate tool.

faqs.a: Orum uses custom pricing â€” no public tiers. Community reports suggest $500-$800/user/month with annual contracts. Contact sales for current pricing.
Yes. Orum has native HubSpot integration for call logging, contact updates, and disposition sync.

Both are strong parallel dialers. Orum has a longer track record and stronger Salesforce integration. Nooks has a higher G2 rating and more recent AI features. The best choice depends on your CRM and team size.

faqs.q: Does Orum have a free trial?
faqs.a: Yes â€” Orum offers a free trial. Contact their sales team to get access.

faqs.q: What's the minimum team size for Orum?
faqs.a: Technically any size, but the economics work best for teams of 5+ SDRs running 50+ dials/day. Below that, the per-seat cost is hard to justify.

finalCta.heading: Ready to 3x Your Live Conversations?
finalCta.body: Orum is built for SDR teams that need more live conversations, not more dials. If your reps are spending more time on voicemails than actual conversations, Orum is worth evaluating.
finalCta.disclaimer: Affiliate link â€” commission earned at no cost to you. Scores and placement are independent of affiliate relationships.

sources.name: G2
sources.whatFound: Strong praise for parallel dialing efficiency and virtual salesfloor. Top complaints: cost for small teams and occasional call quality issues.

sources.name: Reddit (r/sales, r/saleshacks)
sources.whatFound: Generally positive. Reps report 3-5x more live conversations. Common thread: 'worth it if your team does volume.' Concerns about cost for small teams.

sources.name: YouTube (demos & reviews)
sources.whatFound: Official demos show clean UI and fast connect times. Independent reviewers highlight virtual salesfloor as a standout feature.

sources.name: Vendor documentation
sources.whatFound: Well-documented integrations with Salesforce, HubSpot, Outreach, and Salesloft. SOC 2 Type II certification confirmed.

sources.name: Job postings (LinkedIn, Indeed)
sources.whatFound: Orum appears in SDR job requirements at mid-market and enterprise companies. Frequently listed alongside Salesforce and Outreach.
